textBeforeTable: Urgent tasks that need to be finished for the KDE 4.1 release (May 19th): KDE 4.1 / Akonadi 1.0 Core Note: The person noted in the "Contact" column is not necessarily the one implementing that feature, but the one who can tell you what to do and how to help, i.e. you can also contribute to those tasks ;-) The following list contains the things which need to be done for Akonadi. Akonadi TODO 6 Links 5.17 What is the relation between Akonadi and OpenSync? 5.16 How do I completely disable Akonadi startup? 5.15 How do I disable automatic migration from KDE's traditional framework? 5.14 How do I create a collection? 5.13 What's the differences between Akonadi and EDS? 5.12 Can I access the Akonadi server on a remote machine? 5.11 Can a single Akonadi instance be used by multiple users? 5.10 I don't like a database server because of backups/running on NFS/etc. 5.9 Can Akonadi use a normal MySQL server running on my system? 5.8 Do I need a running
